medical_history.chief_complaint: Significant left hip pain following a fall.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with hip pain after slipping onto a wet floor while on the toilet. Symptoms began at the time of the fall, with significant pain reported in the left hip. A CT scan of the head and neck was normal, and an X-ray showed a left inter-trochanteric fracture. The sister reports odd behavior since a recent admission, including repetitive rambling and body movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic abdominal pain/somatic symptom disorder, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), hypertension, atrial fibrillation, anxiety, depression, past narcotic abuse, carotid endarterectomy, cholecystectomy for acute cholangitis, migraines, left-sided ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS), ampullary stenosis.
medical_history.family_history: Significant family history for coronary artery disease (CAD). Mother died secondary to CAD, status post CABG. Father died secondary to CAD, also had CHF and asbestosis. Sister diagnosed with CAD at age ___, also had mitral valvular disease and a stroke. Three brothers with CAD, two of whom have had CABG. Cannot update family history of psychiatric illness.
